history.text: Hi. I just saw a great movie the other night.
Oh yeah? What movie?
It was called Inception. Have you ever seen it?
I think so. Remind me of the plot
Is Leonardo DeCaprio in it?
Yes. He played a highly adept thief, who's "thing" is influencing cons via dream infiltration.
Right right. But then he had a job to actually plant an idea, right?
Yup yup. A Japanese tycoon or some bigshot like that.
Right! It was a pretty good movie, though highly unbelievable.
I mean can you imagine being able to infiltrate people's though OR being able to implant an idea?
That's endless power
True. But, the concept of dream infiltration is something that the CIA had tried to perfect in the 1970s.
Really? I didn't know that
Oh, yeah. Definitely some future reading material for you.

So, unavailability
 aside, did you like the acting?
It was pretty good. I am a fan of Leonardo anyway. So, I may be a little baised.
Haha.. I totally understand. I like him well enough. Thought he was solid in this and DJANGO UNCHAINED.
Django! He seriously pissed me off in that one. So, you know he was believable. LOL
haha! Yeah, proof that the man can act, right?
I do find it funny that a love story found its way into the plot, though
There's always time for hugs and kisses I guess? :)
Always time for hugs (and sometimes kisses). :D
So, I can't remember how it ended. Did they get stuck in a dream or something?
Not all, just Leo.
The ending was a big hotbed of discussion after the movie came out. Theories about Leo not being dead, Leo really did meet up with his children, etc.
That's right. It was so back and forth, I got a little confused myself.
Well, the human mind prefers the happy ending I think. So I would rather believe it ended with him in reality with his kids. :0)
Oh, gosh, yes! Humans have a noted penchant for happy endings. With some movies, people will go so far as to say the ending of a particular film never happened.

What? No!!! That's just weird. I don't want to pretend the ending didn't happen just to make myself believe it was a happier ending. Like in the Titanic. I was mad as hell that she let Leonardo freeze to death. Both of them could have gotten on that door. But, that was the ending. No harm, no foul.
Good point. Clear thinking for sure. Unfortunately, though, I have met/worked with people who  did that kinda stuff.
Man. Oh well. That's right up there with the people who went into depression because Utopia wasn't real. I am more of a realist, I guess.
So, I guess I enjoyed the movie. Solid acting and a limbo ending.
Agreed! :)
The soundtrack to Inception was good. Are you a fan of soundtracks?
I am. But, I don't think I paid much attention to the music on this one. Too busy trying to keep up with the story line.
Have you ever seen Transcendence? It reminds me a lot of this movie?
Yes, I did. I quite liked it. While not something I would want to do/have done to me, I thought the film to be interesting as well as entertaining.
Yes it was! It was also about the subconscious. But the twist was the artificial intelligence angle.
Plus I am a fan of Johnny Depp. So, once again, biased :)
So, I am thinking we are free to finish this conversation. So, I bid you goodbye.
THank you for the chat. Goodbye to you as well.

uid1response.feedback: I don't know if this was a real person or an A.I. simulation, but regardless, this was highly enjoyable as well as interesting.
